author: t
title: Cardano Risk Assessment Tool
description: DeFi markets require a method to judge the trustworthiness of a wallet that is requesting funds.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem described make sense since the proposer put a Decrypt's article about defi users (mostly on Ethereum) lost $10.5B to theft and fraud in 2021. I agree and support this idea because myself as a defi enthusiast sometime need to put a lot of work for assessing a defi platform before put my assets.
Solution and the sample snapshoot of your risk assessment tool intend to assessing wallets not platform, because I see "addr1hy59x..." as a wallet address. Can this tool assessing defi platform too? If this tool able to scale to assessing defi platform, the future impact of this proposal will be huge in Cardano DeFi community. Your hope that this tool will be used to add a measurable layer of confidence and trust to all parties entering into a Cardano DeFi transaction will be achieve successfully.
f6_assessments.q1: Since this proposal's budget want to get 13% of the total $500,000 funding from Boosting DeFi challenge, I have to make sure your Developer's cost first. The conclusions are: I approve it. Because it's reasonable for an average salary in your area (double checked that on payscale.com). The Team skills and experiences are splendid! There's solid evidence from their linkedin profile. Proposer provide realistic timetable too! For me as I'm not working in proposer sector, they described the roadmap very well. Proposer aware with risks and challenges for this project, but they came with alternative way to verify it.
f6_assessments.q2: Very well explained. Through all of the information given, we can have solid understanding about what they make, what is the purpose of this tool, etc.. I believe the auditabily is perfect, no need to criticize. But there's one thing I don't find on this proposal. How to make sure Cardano's community use this Risk Assessment Tool? How do you market this tool? Any partnership, maybe? If the team can approach new DeFI dApps to use the tool, It will be great. (don't forget to update your KPIs if you consider this.)

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal effectively underlines security risks referenced in the challenge brief. However, the solution doesn't seek to address/alleviate the risks associated with smart contract exploits (where user assets are aggregated), but instead focuses on custodial wallet exploits.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team's experience can allow for successful implementation. However, the plan presented has many unknowns that should be clarified. To better assess a real value add, the plan could have elaborated on how "fraud" will be defined and with what parameters (beyond the "phishing bot" eg),. "Fraud" parameters should be clearly and sufficiently scoped and defined for the community to determine logical outgrowth and the potential for unintended consequences. 

Additionally, it's not clear how the scoring method would apply to deposit accounts held in smart contracts. 

Thirdly, raising awareness on the risk profile of a certain address doesn't necessarily solve the problem. Fraudsters can create new wallets using the same "fraud' once profiled. 

Finally, assessor believes that metadata and transaction behavior are too abstract and not the most relevant inputs for individual, custodial wallets given that many instances of fraud are unintentionally "permitted" and therefore technically valid. It may seem arbitrary, but with the right parameters consumers could be entrusted with scoring. The solution should capture prevalent "types" of fraud and raise community awareness.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal gives the duration or amount of time specific tasks will take, but it's not clear whether they can be pursued concurrently, where there are interdependencies, and how long the overall project will take to complete.

f6_assessments.q0: An innovative idea that would create a paradigm shift in Defi space if well implemented, the proposer outlines exactly the role of such a solution in Cardano's space and its positive effect on the community and mainly other projects.
f6_assessments.q1: The team provided links to Linkedin pages of the main members and a link showing that they have been part of the PLUTUS first cohort. They also present a clear roadmap with specific goals and outlines to what needs to be done. Furthermore, they added a Faq section that talks about questions the voter might ask themselves. On the other, the technical specifics of the protocol were not shared or explained in detail.
f6_assessments.q2: The team prepared a very detailed list of the needs of this project and its budget allocations. They also prepared a roadmap with different milestones that are clear and will allow the community to assess their development.

solution: Develop a Risk Assessment Oracle. A public web-service to predict the fraud risk of a given wallet i.e. if it belongs to a fraudster.
